definition: to control/to restrict/to moderate/to temper/moderation/sobriety/to administer
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.chinese: 除了美德，一切须有节制。

sentences.english: Dieting is of great benefit to the over-weighted people.
sentences.chinese: 节制饮食对超重的人是非常有益的。

sentences.english: Ask God to give you and your spouse the wisdom and discipline to manage money well.
sentences.chinese: 求神给你和你的爱人有智慧和节制来把钱管理好。

sentences.english: The controlled release of water from reservoirs.
sentences.chinese: 从水库中有节制地放水。

sentences.english: But as with everything, it should be eaten in moderation!
sentences.chinese: 但是正如一切事情一样，应该有节制地食用它。

sentences.english: The intemperate life style is the patient population sharp increase primary factor.
sentences.chinese: 无节制的生活方式是患者人数剧增的主要因素。

sentences.english: Discuss the effectiveness of sexual abstinence programs in the fight against STDS.
sentences.chinese: 讨论在对抗性传播疾病中节制性活动的效力。

sentences.english: The Adagio section ends in a relatively subdued and bright mood.
sentences.chinese: 慢板于此处带著节制的开朗情绪中暂时告一段落。

sentences.english: During treatment, sexual activity should be abstinent .
They are working hard to produce a program-controlled computer.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在起劲打造一台程序节制计算机。

sentences.english: She should moderate her language when children are present.
sentences.chinese: 在孩子面前，她说话应该节制。

sentences.english: We weren't poor. But we always had modest Christmases.
sentences.chinese: 我们家并不穷，但我们的圣诞礼物总是很有节制。

sentences.english: People of the Dong ethnic group in Hunan province have the custom of making kippers during Cold Dew.
sentences.chinese: 在寒露时节制腌鱼是湖南侗家人的习俗。

sentences.english: The newts are very gluttonous but rather dovish!
sentences.chinese: 这些蝾螈非常的贪吃但是它们也是相当有节制的。

definition: to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
to comply with/to follow (directives)/to defer (to the judgment of superiors)
to transfer/to maneuver (troops etc)/movement of personnel/to mobilize/to bring into play
to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
to listen and obey/to comply with/to heed/to hearken
